meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: If Steve Jobs were still alive, would the new map application on the iPhone 5 be such an unmitigated disaster? Interesting question, isn’t it?

li.div: Are journalists required by editors to ask is it over for Apple now Steve Jobs is dead in response to any incident? - nytimes.com/2012/09/22/opi...

div.a: Bath Salts: The Drug That Never Lets Go

div.div: Taking MDPV, a common ingredient in Bath Salts, is like taking cocaine and amphetamines at the same time only it's ten times stronger.

li.div: A compelling, horrifying read: 'Bath Salts: The Drug That Never Lets Go' pbs.org/newshour/multimedi...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NEHEk9&via=Digg&text=Bath Salts: The Drug That Never Lets Go

div.a: The Time Abraham Lincoln Almost Dueled Someone With A Broadsword On An Island

div.div: Exactly 170 years ago today, the Mississippi River levee in Alton, Illinois, was crammed full of spectators awaiting the results of a highly anticipated duel — a smackdown between Abraham Lincoln and political rival James Shields.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/PU0mB2&via=Digg&text=The Time Abraham Lincoln Almost Dueled Someone With A Broadsword On An Island

div.a: FBI Renews Broad Internet Surveillance Push

div.div: Director Robert Mueller tells Congress that police are "increasingly unable" to bring criminals to justice because rapid advances in technology thwart surveillance.

div.a: How Did Soldier Not Know She Was Pregnant?

div.div: An active-duty British soldier who reportedly didn't realize she was pregnant until she went into labor delivered a baby boy in a field hospital in Afghanistan on Tuesday.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VljUCj&via=Digg&text=How Did Soldier Not Know She Was Pregnant?

div.div: Do animals have a sense of how much time has passed?

div.a: From Shopping To Warfare, Why Maps Shape Our Minds As Well As Our Planet

div.div: Maps are at the center of a worldwide commercial power struggle this weekend as Apple faces criticism of the technology it has developed for its new smartphone. But maps have been at the center of both politics and commerce down the ages, as well as key to the development of the human imagination.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q590ju&via=Digg&text=From Shopping To Warfare, Why Maps Shape Our Minds As Well As Our Planet

div.a: Louvre Museum To Display Images Of Mohammed In New Wing

div.div: one of the Louvre’s own consultants acknowledged that some Muslims could be “shocked” by three images of Muhammad with his face exposed in the new wing.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SihJRp&via=Digg&text=Louvre Museum To Display Images Of Mohammed In New Wing

div.a: How Drones Are Being Transformed Into Photographers

div.div: The use of drones in Pakistan normally brings to mind images of U.S. spy planes attacking tribal areas. But drones now are being used to capture a different kind of picture in the country.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QtNuSS&via=Digg&text=How Drones Are Being Transformed Into Photographers

div.a: Watch This Brand New iPhone 5 Burst Into Flame

div.div: So what are you gonna do, now that you have the object of your affection? Nuke it, of course. Pop it in the microwave and let it roast. Kill it with fire!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NHWiqN&via=Digg&text=Watch This Brand New iPhone 5 Burst Into Flame

div.div: AN OPEN INTERNET IS A 'SPECIAL INTEREST?'
Romney thinks the FCC’s rules promoting “net neutrality” are the fulfillment of a campaign promise that was made to “special interests.”
Just hours after the new Apple iPhone 5 was released, it has already been jailbroken.

div.a: Motorola Mobility (Google) Pokes Fun At Apple's iOS 6 Maps With #iLost Hashtag

div.div: Ok, I’m not a fan of Maps in iOS 6 as you might have read. Seems like the folks over at Google aren’t either.

div.div: Dirk Dzimirsky is one talented guy. People are often surprised that his hyperrealistic drawings are not actual photographs.
